items.sentence: Do you think that Tom knows I want to go to Australia?
I didn't think Tom would be in Australia last weekend.
What's the best birthday present you've ever received?
What's the best advice that anyone has ever given you?
You're going the wrong way. You've got to turn around.
We had an opportunity to change things, but we didn't.
When everything's ready, let's put a sign on the door.
Tom wants you to know that he really wants to do that.
I make it a rule not to speak French in the classroom.
The plot was so complicated that I couldn't follow it.
I think I already know what you're going to say to me.
You're right. The noodle soup is a bit expensive here.
I don't think Tom knows what kind of music Mary likes.
I don't think it's very likely Tom will be here today.
I don't think that Tom would help me with my homework.
I don't think Tom will be as picky as Mary usually is.
I don't think that this is a good time to talk to Tom.
I don't think that it would be wise to argue with Tom.
I don't think that Tom knows how to speak French well.
I don't think that Tom is going to be here until 2:30.
